text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
MATERIAL CHANGES

Editorial changes have been made to update IRM/statute/organizational references and terms. Web and citation references were added/updated throughout to make the text easier to research in electronic media.
IRM
, Background - Added information about the background of policies pertaining Exempt Organizations. Information from prior subsection
was incorporated into this subsection. IRM
, Authority - Added legal authorities pertaining to the Exempt Organizations process. IRM
, Responsibilities - This IRM applies to all Internal Revenue Service (IRS) personnel and contractors who provide records under the provisions of IRM
Disclosure Official Information. IRM
, Terms/Deﬁnitions/Acronyms - Compiled a list of frequently used terms, deﬁnitions and acronyms pertaining to the Exempt Organizations process. IRM
, Related Resources - Added related resources applicable to the Exempt Organizations process.
All other subsequent sections were renumbered accordingly.

Updated the title of IRM 11.3.9.2 to Authority for Inspection of Material Relating to Exempt Organizations. Added new (1) to provide background information. Moved paragraph from (14) to (2) for ease of reading. Added additional supporting citation to (3), (7), (8) and (9). Updated (7) to add information on the Form 990-T return. Deleted sentence from (10) that was obsolete. Added Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) contact information to (12). Added new (19) to provide information on Privacy Act access to records.

Updated example in IRM 11.3.9.3(1) to be more generic. Removed reference to Disclosure personnel in (2) to ensure all persons are aware of the requirement to contact Counsel in certain situations. Changed format of information in (3) from table to bulleted list for ease of reading. Added Note to (3) to ensure personnel are aware that redactions may need to be made. Updated second Note in (4) to add supporting IRM section.

Updated title of IRM 11.3.9.8 to Inspection of Approved Applications and Related Documents. Deleted (2), (4), (8) and (9) as the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Reading Room is no longer in operation. Updated (7) to reﬂect that the FOIA Reading Room is no longer in operation.
Updated (1) of IRM 11.3.9.10 to add supporting citation. Updated (2) to provide TE/GE contact information and remove mailing address.
Deleted IRM 11.3.9.11.2, Processing Requests for Exempt Organization Returns, to limit this IRM to information within the scope of Disclosure.

Deleted (1) of IRM 11.3.9.12 to limit this IRM to information within the scope of Disclosure. Subsequent sections renumbered accordingly. Added supporting citations to (1). Added website link to second Exception in (2). Removed Note in (3) to limit this IRM to information the scope of Disclosure.
Added Note to IRM 11.3.9.13 to identify that all identiﬁed Social Security Numbers (SSNs) should withheld from release.
Updated title of IRM 11.3.9.14 to Inspection of Annual Returns and Applications for Tax Exempt Status. Updated (1) to add supporting citation. Updated (2) to add supporting IRM reference.
Updated (3) of IRM 11.3.9.16 to provide clarity on locating the Statistics of Income website.
Added (2) to IRM 11.3.9.17 to address Exempt Organizations that request their own returns.

)(A) requires certain tax exempt organization documents by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), be open to inspection at such times and in such places as the Secretary of Treasury may prescribe. This IRM section provides guidance. (
) Audience: These procedures apply to all IRS employees, and contractors. (

11.3 Disclosure of Official Information

TE/GE employees should consult with the Disclosure PPO Senior Disclosure Analyst for TE/GE and/or other employees as GLDS may direct, for disclosure concerns that are not clear under IRC §6104 or the regulations.
A legally formed organization that is exempt from federal income taxation under IRC §

(a). The most common types are charitable, religious and educational organizations, civic associations, labor orga- nizations, business leagues, social clubs, fraternal organizations and veterans’ organizations.

Any person engaged in a trade or business, including a corporation, partnership, individual, estate, and trust, who makes reportable trans- actions during the calendar year, must ﬁle information returns to report those transactions to the IRS.
The terms “inspected” and “inspection” mean any review of a return or return information.

Any tax or information return, declaration of estimated tax, or claim for refund required by IRC § 6103 which is ﬁled with the Secretary, including any amendment or supplement. See IRC §6103(b)(1) for the statutory deﬁnition.

A taxpayer’s identity, the nature, source, or amount of his income, payments, receipts, deductions, exemptions, credits, assets, net worth, tax liability, tax withheld, deﬁciencies, overassessments, or tax payments. See IRC §6103(b)(2) for the statutory deﬁnition.

(a), (b), and (d) was to enable the public to the activities of tax exempt organizations and trusts. Congress intended these organizations and trusts be subject to a certain degree of public ability in view of their privileged tax status and because the public has a to know for what purposes their contributions are being or will be used.
